key_points: Donald John Trump was born in Queens, New York, on June 14, 1946.
He took over his father's real estate company in 1971, later expanding it into various sectors.
Trump has written several books, including 'The Art of the Deal' and launched the reality TV show 'The Apprentice'.
He won the 2016 Presidential Election, defeating Hillary Clinton with a majority of Electoral College votes.
Trump's presidency was marked by tax reform, trade tariffs, and significant judicial appointments.
His administration moved the U.S. Embassy in Israel to Jerusalem and engaged in historic talks with North Korea.
A partial government shutdown occurred in 2018 due to disagreements over funding for a border wall.
Trump was impeached in 2019 over allegations of obstruction and abuse of power but was acquitted by the Senate.
His handling of the COVID-19 pandemic was widely criticized, with over 400,000 American deaths by the end of his term.
Trump was impeached a second time for incitement of insurrection after the storming of the Capitol on January 6, 2021.
